Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a grey-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is slightly ribbed and spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394390) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394390)
